intro: Ceratostema charianthum, commonly known as the mountain snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Sarcandraceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
